Type of reform, it’s easy to see why the liberals have dropped it. The parties all favour something different- much like Canadians do.
But when over 70 percent of people in their poll and great number of experts and witness saying you need broad support for a specific
A factor, sure. But there had to be other reasons to pick lib over ndp.
To be fair, electoral reform was on the NDP platform too- so to say you voted liberal for reform, isn’t entirely fair.
@Kaylee_Scout Oh, we're all just pretending.
@Kaylee_Scout Adulting is overrated.
Maybe if you communicated with the membership, this wouldn't happen?
@warandpeace Toub I have is this- they're not interacting with chat because playing the game, or interacting and not playing game
@apukwa No, as long as boomers vote, a lot of issues won't change.
@apukwa Frankly, I don't believe for a second NDP would have implemented anything either.
The beams! https://t.co/2l0d4mfdNF
@9x19 @apukwa to be fair, I heard from the media all the way through this thing that no one was agreeing with each other.
@apukwa @9x19 They sure aren't, but by asking value questions instead of specific methods, you get what people actually want vs. think.
@9x19 @apukwa TBF, if the Liberals picked a specific reform, the NDP and cons would have attacked for picking one that benefits liberals.
which is the way you pick a system without political preference.
And frankly, I don’t blame the liberals- they asked value questions vs questions that bring bias into the mix.
Keep in mind, boomers probably had their say in the fptp debate.

@MarkDice I'm confused, World Scouting is an extremely liberal multicultural movement and has been for 100 years. It's always been liberal.
@daphne_mir @AylaMitten wait, there was a ride? I really need to go back to Disneyland. It’s only been 22 years.
@zutzy the river is gold creek in golden ears.
@zutzy yes and yes. The high school interior is point grey, exterior is lord byng.
@alexsteacy Gold anything doesn't matter if your team didn't win. :/
@dixonij Yeah, that's fair.
@scouterjohio It took 27 years for SC to go fully co-ed. It's actually quite impressive for the BSA. I suspect there is pressure from WOSM.
Scouting has been fully co-ed in Canada since '98, and in most cases since '92 and older sections since the late 60s.- Nearly 50 years.
Good. Another step closer for Scouting for everyone in the US. https://t.co/ecxNqslo6a

You could have picked Jeb!
@gfors We'll see, won't we- we're still a year and a half from election time. Lots of things can change.
@gfors Hadden park has a clause that it must remain "natural" when it was gifted to CoV. it was the reason the bike route wasn't installed.
@gfors Fact of the matter is that Greenways- at least CoV's definition have been around for 25 years.
@gfors I'm sorry, but on an ecological level- nothing in Kits, Hadden or Vanier is natural- It's insane that the "natural" clause was used.
@gfors and aside from bits of Kitsilano that seem to think grass is "natural" the general consensus is that the Seawall is a good thing.
@gfors I mean the other thing here is what is generally presented here is something we already have in Vancouver.
@gfors You mean the project that started in August, and had a noticeable effect not even three weeks later? The corridor goes for 70 blocks.
@gfors @YuriArtibise Sigh, that's not what I meant, but I wouldn't surprised if it is people who live walking distance away
@dixonij ever have a shot at Conservative leader if Trump wasn't elected. :/
@dixonij And people here don't seem to understand why Trump being elected is bad for canada. :/ In no way would Leitch or O'leary...
@Fugiman Youth orgs to prevent this from being needed in the first place?
@catssidy Oh I know, but It's nice when doctors are like, No. this person is sick, let them recover and be done with it.
@catssidy I love that doctors now are starting to charge employers for sick notes.
@gfors @YuriArtibise Much like the seawall does for much of it's length.
@gfors @YuriArtibise Doing what the city is doing has opened up the corridor to people who don't live five minutes away.
@gfors @YuriArtibise The corridor is more than just Kitsilano- I grew up here- no one used this unless you live with in five minutes of it.
@gfors Apparently Overgrown doesn't describe plants that covered a good 20 metres to cover the tracks. Who knew?!
@gfors @YuriArtibise Or the massive amounts of invasive plants that went uncontrolled for years along the corridor?
@gfors @YuriArtibise And if you mean uniquely used, you mean getting rid of overgrown foliage which only grew up due to lack of use from CN?
@gfors @YuriArtibise to be fair, they started in august. And then nimbys whinged.
@gfors @YuriArtibise even thought about walking on it, since y’know it was illegal and CN did actually do checks and wrote tickets.
@gfors @YuriArtibise and More people are using it now, which is the point of the temporary route. Keep in mind, if you weren’t local no one
